Title: Teaching and Learning from Teaching Makeup

Content.Knowledge Point: The importance of sharing stories and personal journey
Content.Text: What I've learned by teaching this class is that, yes, I'm a makeup artist. Yes, I like to teach technique. But I've also learned how much I really care about sharing stories and telling you my journey so it will encourage you on your own.

Content.Knowledge Point: The value of hard work and being nice to people
Content.Text: My advice to all you guys out there, whether you're a future makeup artist or passionate about what you're doing, know that anything is possible. That's a wrap. You have to work hard and you have to just keep at it. I'm running on fumes. And just realize you have to be nice to people. If you're not nice, no one's going to want to be around you.

Content.Knowledge Point: The importance of being proactive and helpful on set
Content.Text: Even when you're on a set, if you are just sitting there on your phone and no one's doing anything, guess what? You should not just be sitting there. Someone might need some help. You know, the model should have maybe a glass of water. The photographer might need some help. Maybe there's a dog sitting around the set. Ask if you could take the dog out.

Content.Knowledge Point: The need for practice and continuous improvement
Content.Text: Go back. Look in the mirror. Practice. Grab someone. Do their makeup. Practice. And I hope that what I've taught you, you'll be able to take and just become a better version of yourself. Through health and wellness. Through creativity. Careers. Through makeup. Through everything.
